description.narrative: - Supply Chain Linkages & Access to Farmers: Tiryaki sources directly from more than 2,850 farmers (all of whom are MSMEs) in Turkey, providing them seeds and pre-financing in the process excluding 30-40 wholesalers who have supply linkages with individual farmers. - Supporting a Regional Player: The Project will improve competitiveness of the Company as well as underline its market position in Turkey which has substantional room for competition. - Job Preservation and Tax Revenues for the Governments: Given that agribusiness is a strategic sector for Turkey, accounting for 25% of employment, the Project will help the sector to preserve the job while increasing tax revenues to the Government on the back of improved supply chain linkages as well as sound operations of the Company.

As an agricultural commodity trade and supply chain manager since early 80s, Tiryaki Agro Gida Sanayi ve Ticaret A.S. (the Company or Tiryaki) is engaged in sourcing, processing and storage of both conventional and organic agricultural products with a storage capacity of more than 500,000 tons. The proposed project involves refinancing of the existing working capital facility of and to finance incremental working capital needs required for the Companys growth in operations at an estimated cost of US$330 million (the Project). The Project will ensure Tiryakis continued access to working capital funding which is critical for the Companys growth.

name.narrative: The proposed IFC investment will be a corporate loan and there will be no particular project location. Nevertheless, the Company is headquartered in Istanbul while its processing and storage facilities are located in Turkey (e.g., Gaziantep, Balikesir, Corum, Mersin and Trabzon) and Jordan. The Company has two sales offices in Dubai/UAE & China.
